moves.1. e4 b6 2. d4 Bb7 3. Nc3 e6: I've been experimenting with this setup for Black.  I wasn't very happy with the position I got in this game!
moves.4. Nf3 d6 5. Bb5+ Nd7 6. Bg5 Be7 7. Qd2: I feel like Black's pieces are already placed passively.
moves.7... Bxg5 8. Nxg5 Qe7 9. Qf4 f6 10. Nf3: Black's King is a little more secure, but White is better developed and has more space.
moves.13. d5 e5 14. Bc6: I'm not sure it was best for White to trade off this piece.
moves.14... Bxc6 15. dxc6 Nb8 16. Nd5 Qe8: The c6 pawn will be lost now.
moves.17. Qc3 Qxc6 18. b4 Qxc3 19. Nxc3: Trading Queens improves Black's chances of survival.
moves.19... Ne7: White's N on d5 would be very annoying.
moves.28. Re2 Nc4: Adding a third attacker, which will win the exchange.
